Text: RBCEnronfor your review is a draft of the Acknowledgment Agreement MACLEODdoc

RBCEnronEMAIL IS BEING RESENT AS IT HAS COME TO OUR ATTENTION THAT SOME OF YOU DID NOT RECEIVE SAME LAST NIGHT The following are the comments of Macleod Dixon and RBC on the following documents Enron Corp Guaranty The Guaranty in favour of RBC needs to apply to two confirmations the commodity swap and the interest rate swap The definition of Contract appears to apply to only one Confirmation There are some minor deficiencies such as an undefined reference to Beneficiaries in the definition of Subordinated Debt and the word and should be deleted from the beginning of the definition of Total Senior Debt The limitation in Section can be reduced to Please insert a representation in Section that Enron Canada is a Principal Subsidiary The paragraph in Section regarding reservation of setoff rights is too broad in several respects Firstly it should not apply to setoff claims held by any affiliate of the Guarantor other than Enron Canada and should be limited to setoff claims arising out of the Contract The address of RBC for the notice clause is the same as in the ISDA Schedule Is the last sentence in Section d meant to be a limitation and is it missing the word not ISDA Schedule Obviously there will now be only one Schedule and Party B will be RBC The trustee nonrecourse provisions can also be deleted We assume that a single ISDA will cover both Swap and Swap Section cii should apply to all Transactions since RBC cannot as an operational matter accommodate netting between interest and commodity swaps Although the two Confirmations will be accepted at the closing we should discuss the execution mechanism in Section eii which contemplates that there is deemed immediate acceptance if RBC fails to accept the Confirmation after effective delivery Our understanding is that the transfer provisions would limit the transferees to North America since any transferee must be in an RBC approved jurisdiction Our understanding is that the bilateral optional termination rights will continue to apply We presume that the notice period will be relatively short eg days Also there is a reference to the Calculation Agent in the last sentence of Section f which should probably contemplate the joint selection concept referred to above In addition why doesnt the joint selection of Reference Marketmakers apply to any termination Our understanding is that collateral in the form of Letters of Credit will be required to be posted to cover any out of the money position by a party whose credit rating drops below BBB ISDA Confirmations Obviously the dates and parties to the Commodity Swap Confirmation must be updated The Termination Date should be September The Fixed Amount should be The delivery date of March in the definition of Floating Price needs to be confirmed by the traders Assuming a Friday closing date the calculation periods should be a September December b December March c March June d June September Opinions Please provide revised drafts of the relevant opinions which reflect the new structure
RBCEnronfor your review is a draft of the Acknowledgment Agreement MACLEODdoc
